intro: Stephania hallieri, commonly known as the New Zealand native stephania, is a climbing plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in forested areas and is often found along stream banks. It has a long vine-like stem that can reach several meters in length. The plant is known for its medicinal properties and has been used by Māori for traditional healing purposes.
